thread.title: Easton Tigers Mites celebrate perfect season
thread.title_full: Easton Tigers Mites celebrate perfect season

author: Maria Papadopoulos
title: Easton Tigers Mites celebrate perfect season
text: Easton Tigers Mites celebrate perfect season Comment Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 7:36 PM Updated at 7:46 PM Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 7:36 PM Updated at 7:46 PM EASTON – Sean Smith is very proud of his winning team. Smith, head coach of the Easton Tigers Mites football team, is celebrating, along with his players, their 28-0 win over the Braintree Mites on Sunday. The Easton team played a perfect season, winning eight games to advance to the Mite Bowl in Braintree next Sunday. Games start at noon at Braintree High School. “They’ve been playing very well,” Smith, 30, said after his team’s win at Oliver Ames High School on Sunday afternoon. “I would say our defense is what carried us, very good defense.” There are 20 players on the team, ages 7 to 9 years old. The players are: Benjamin Alonzo, Atticus Bonny, Daniel Casey, Robert Dobbin, Matthew Driscoll, Justin Grimaldi, Harry Leventhal, Soren Lolonga, Jake McGarry, Michael McGinnis, Jared Murphy, Aidan O’Connell, Nathan Pailler, Case Rivera, Douglas Smith, Ryan Smith, Brady Somers, Andrew Sullivan, Evan Szumylo, and Jack Yelle. Smith said four assistant coaches worked with the team: Greg Sullivan, Mike Somers, Chris Darling, and Lee McGinnis. Reach Maria Papadopoulos at mpapa@enterprisenews.com or follow on Twitter @MariaP_ENT.
